alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 21 at 8:01PM EDT until July 22 at 8:35AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Peachtree Creek at Atlanta affecting Fulton and DeKalb Counties. For the Peachtree Creek...including Atlanta...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Peachtree Creek at Atlanta. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Moderate flooding begins along portions of the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Northside Drive. A parking lot near the corner of Peachtree Road and Fairhaven Circle begins to flood. Woodward Way will flood with 1 to 5 feet of water and reach the foundation of some homes that have not been elevated. Sections of Hanover West Drive and backyards on portions of Peachtree Battle Avenue will flood with 1 to 3 feet of water and it will be reaching the foundation of some homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:31 PM EDT Friday the stage was 14.5 feet and rising rapidly. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 18.5 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
